post_text: From fine arts to athletics to high-quality teachers, our results are real in Arlington ISD. For the first time during a transfer campaign, students can apply to one of our five elementary academies now through Friday, Sept. 18 at 4 p.m. That means your child could attend Jones Academy, Corey Academy, Wimbish World Language Academy, Pearcy STEM Academy or Crow Leadership Academy based on availability. Learn more on our blog. https://bddy.me/32w20HU

post_text: ‚ÄúThe Back to School Kickoff was a wonderful success,‚Äù said Arlington ISD Superintendent Dr. Marcelo Cavazos. Ten thousand backpacks filled with school supplies were distributed to Arlington ISD students thanks to generous sponsors and local volunteers! Over the last six years, the Arlington ISD Back to School Kickoff has brought joy and excitement for the upcoming school year to students who otherwise might not feel confident and ready for classes to begin. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for your support.

post_text: Tickets for all Arlington ISD varsity and non-varsity sports games will only be sold through our new online ticket provider Ticket Spicket. post_text: The Arlington ISD Board of Trustees approved a waiver on Thursday, Sept. 3, that will allow the school district to offer in-person instruction under safety guidelines recommended by the Tarrant County Public Health from Monday, Sept. 28 to Friday, Oct. 9. As we proceed, instruction will be on a hybrid schedule, where students will attend in-person classes on specific days, for the families who choose in-person instruction. Families who choose to continue virtual learning will be allowed to do so. Read more online at https://www.aisd.net/return-to-school-2020/parent-resources/.

Families who choose to continue virtual learning will be allowed to do so. Read more online at https://www.aisd.net/return-to-school-2020/parent-resources/.

post_text:
Students and parents: We understand that the new school year looks different than it has in the past. As we begin online instruction, we recognize that there may be some feelings of uncertainty, but our social and emotional team is just a phone call away. Every Monday through Friday from noon to 4 p.m., staff who specialize in school counseling and community referral services will operate our hotline numbers. Students, we can help if you‚Äôre struggling with grades. Parents, if you are in need of resources such as food, utility assistance and/or help with loss of housing please call.
School Counseling Hotline: (682) 867-9416
Community Support Services Hotline: (682) 867-9417
You can read more in our latest blog post https://www.aisd.net/district-news/hotlines-offer-support-for-students-and-parents/

post_text:
Fall meal distribution has begun for Arlington ISD students. Read our latest blog post explaining the dates, times and locations that meals will be distributed https://www.aisd.net/district-news/arlington-isds-chef-karl-offers-tips-and-tricks/. Chef Karl Betts of our food and nutrition services department has even made videos on how to prepare several of the meals students receive each week! Watch now.

Tomorrow, Thursday, August 20 lunch times will extend from 10:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Then beginning Tuesday, August 25 lunch times change permanently from 11:30 a.m to 1:30 p.m. as we switch to a Tuesday-Thursday schedule.

post_text: Arlington ISD Superintendent Dr. Marcelo Cavazos gave the annual State of the District Address hosted by the Greater Arlington Chamber of Commerce and sponsored by Baylor Scott & White Orthopedic and Spine Hospital on Friday. This year the address was live streamed on the Chamber‚Äôs Facebook page. Dr. Cavazos recognized community partners like the Dallas Cowboys and the Gene and Jerry Jones Foundation with the Business Partner of the Year Award, and Arlington Charities as our Community Partner of the Year. Dr. Cavazos also discussed the return to school this fall, social and racial injustice, the Voter Approved Tax Ratification Election or VA-TRE, and more. Watch the full video here.

post_text: Explore your potential in the visual arts. If painting, drawing or sculpting is your passion and career goal but you have no idea what the next steps are, let our team of educators at the Center for Visual and Performing Arts help. Professionals who are masters in their field will surround you with an extraordinary knowledge base to guide you through a one-of-a kind experience. While the International Baccalaureate (IB) Visual Arts program is open to juniors and seniors, a variety of programs are open to all students in grades 9, 10, 11 and 12 who register through their school counselors. Learn more at https://bddy.me/3ifevfI.

Programs like this and more are open to all students in grades 9, 10, 11 and 12 who register through their school counselors. Learn more at https://www.aisd.net/district/departments/administration/fine-arts/cvpa/.

post_text: Public health authorities in Tarrant County, the City of Arlington and the City of Burleson signed a Joint Control Order that will keep all of our schools closed to in-person classes through Sunday, September 27, 2020, due to the surge of COVID-19 cases in Tarrant County. While in-person instruction will be pushed back, online instruction will begin on Monday, August 17. We know the start of the school year is going to be unlike anything we‚Äôve ever been through before. We can not express enough how much we appreciate your support and patience, not only throughout last spring, but into the fall as well. For complete details visit https://www.aisd.net/families/return-to-school-2020/parent-resources/.

post_text:
The City of Arlington, TX - City Hall invites residents to pick up one box of 50 masks per vehicle from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. today, July 16, at the Dan Dipert Career and Technical Center at 2101 Browning Drive. The Texas Rangers have also generously donated cloth masks, which will be available at the location while supplies last. If you have any questions please call 817-459-6777.

For more information on the benefits of wearing a mask watch the latest Ask Arlington interview with Dr. Susan Bailey, president of the American Medical Association. https://arlingtontx.gov/news/my_arlington_t_x/news_stories/ask_arlington_coronavirus_masks

post_text: Blanton Elementary recently placed first in the 2019 Battle of the Buildings, a contest by the TEMA Texas Energy Managers Association, by reducing its energy consumption from one year to the next more than any other school facility in the contest. This outstanding achievement can be directly tied to the 2014 Bond, which funded a project that replaced Blanton‚Äôs old chilled water system with new high-efficiency roof-top units and provided electric controls for the HVAC system. Read more! https://www.aisd.net/district-news/blanton-elementary-wins-statewide-energy-conservation-contest/

post_text:
We are deeply saddened to learn that the namesake of Anderson Elementary passed away on Sunday, July 12. Beth Anderson was a devoted teacher throughout her years at Southside, Speer and Berry Elementary schools.

Mrs. Anderson was committed to the community and participated in local organizations such as the Arlington Arts League, Friends of the UTA Library, Arlington Memorial Hospital Auxiliary, The Women‚Äôs Shelter, and many more.

Our condolences go out to Mrs. Anderson‚Äôs family and friends. She will be dearly missed. https://www.aisd.net/district-news/arlington-isd-says-goodbye-to-beth-anderson/

Tarrant Area Food Bank along with their community partners will host a food distribution event at Globe Life Field on Tuesday, June 30 from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. (noon). Food will be offered to everyone who attends. The event will take place in Prius Lot F on the corner of East Copeland Road and AT&T Way. Visit https://tafb.org/tafb-events/tafb-food-for-all-distribution-site/?fbclid=IwAR3nRMyfQ9Kq-uyefYOtRVVwHcmM_heXrY1fT7dMTH2PJXOBx-HHtZEcTpE to learn more or call 817-857-7100 with any questions.

Food items that will be distributed at this event include:
- Fresh produce
- Frozen chicken
- Shelf-stable dry goods
- Milk

- Frozen chicken
- Shelf-stable dry goods
- Milk

Tarrant Area Food Bank
June 26 at 1:00 PM ¬∑

We are excited to announce our second large scale food distribution, located in the parking area of Globe Life Field! The event is this Tuesday, June 30th, from 8:00 am to 12:00 noon. All are welcome to come and receive food from this event. Visit https://tafb.org/tafb-events/tafb-food-for-all-distribution-site/ to learn more!

post_text:
While guidance on COVID-19 safety protocols at the state and local level fluctuate from day-to-day, Arlington ISD Superintendent Dr. Marcelo Cavazos announced options in an email to parents this morning for back to school in the fall.

Parents have choices.
1. Enroll students for in-person instruction (as allowed by the
Texas governor)
2. Or enroll students for online instruction

Registration opens on Tuesday, July 7 at aisd.net/register. At any time during the year, parents can change their mind and select the other option. By making a choice, parents can help us plan for a safe return to the classroom when appropriate.

School is scheduled to begin on August 17, 2020. Complete details as of Friday, June 26 can be found at https://www.aisd.net/district-news/superintendent-updates-families-for-their-return-to-school-this-fall/.

post_text: Former Boles Junior High School student and 1997 James Martin High School graduate Seba Suber recently shared her story with us. The CEO of the Houston Museum of African American Culture was recently interviewed by the BBC on the social injustices movement taking place worldwide. Seba talked with us about her observations on where we are as a nation in regards to race and where we can go if we open up discussion and listen to the voices in our community. Read more about this Arlington ISD graduate doing great things to make a difference in our world today. https://www.aisd.net/district-news/martin-graduate-making-impact-socially/ #ArlingtonISD #Alumni Houston Museum of African American Culture

post_text:
Our success in Arlington ISD depends upon a commitment by all to a clear and focused vision, effective teaching and leadership, a positive culture that promotes continuous improvement by all and an engaged community.

Therefore, we resolve to conduct a comprehensive examination of our culture, curriculum, instruction and internal systems and to strengthen, improve and modify our institution as needed to ensure racial and social equity and to remedy systemic bias and racism.

Read more at https://www.aisd.net/district-news/arlington-isd-resolution-on-racial-and-social-equity/.

post_text:
Arlington ISD high school graduation ceremonies begin on Friday, June 5 at AT&T Stadium. To watch LIVE from anywhere in the world, visit the graduation page on our website at https://www.aisd.net/students/graduation/#watch.

Here is the list of schools, dates and times our ceremonies will take place:
Lamar High School Friday, June 5 at 3:30 p.m.
Arlington High School Saturday, June 6 at 10 a.m.
Seguin High School Saturday, June 6 at 3 p.m.
James Martin High School Saturday, June 6 at 8 p.m.
Arlington Collegiate High School Sunday, June 7 at 10 a.m.
James Bowie High School Sunday, June 7 at 3 p.m.
Sam Houston High School - AISD Sunday, June 7 at 8 p.m.

We cannot thank the Gene and Jerry Jones Foundation and Charlotte Jones enough for their generous gift to hold the 2020 Arlington ISD commencement ceremonies at AT&T Stadium. #ThankYou #ClassOf2020

post_text:
Clap out recap! Sixth graders across Arlington ISD participated in a one-of-a-kind send-off closing out their elementary school days last week. These kiddos demonstrated resilience and positive attitudes as they ended one part of their lives during a pandemic while preparing for the next series of milestones that will begin with entering junior high school. #ArlingtonISD
Key Elementary School
Arlington High School
Hale Elementary
Pearcy Elementary School
Jones Academy of Fine Arts & Dual Language
Duff Elementary
Short Elementary School
Bryant Elementary School
Adams Elementary School

post_text:
We‚Äôre coming to you LIVE from the J. W. Counts administration building where our 25, 30, 35, and 40-year employees are being treated to a BBQ lunch for their years of service. Tune in as Superintendent Dr. Marcelo Cavazos shares his gratitude for the dedication and commitment to education by these employees.

Team #ArlingtonISD: We're proud of you and we want you to know just how much! Add an Arlington ISD Facebook frame to your profile picture today.
1. Tap on your profile picture.
3. Then select "Add Frame".
4. In the search bar at the top, type in Arlington ISD.
5. Select the frame of your choice.

Check out pictures from today's event and the Waterford crystal retirement give-a-way from last week at https://www.flickr.com/photos/arlingtonisd/sets/72157714542087243/.

post_text: We‚Äôre excited to announce a new partnership with Child Care Associates that establishes the first Head Start Pre-K PLUS program at an Arlington ISD campus. This new program will bring the district‚Äôs outstanding Pre-K programming to even more of the community‚Äôs preschool-age children. It will also include the district‚Äôs first free full-day Pre-K program for 3-year-olds! Learn more in our latest blog post. https://www.aisd.net/district-news/arlington-isd-announces-new-head-start-pre-k-program/ #BigDreamers

post_text: Today was the last day of school for an unconventional school year. Dr. Marcelo Cavazos talks about the upcoming graduation ceremonies, student food plans for the summer and what might be in store in the fall. We want to take a moment to thank students, teachers, parents, staff and the entire community for your passion and compassion as we have navigated through uncharted waters. It hasn't been easy, but you have been an inspiration every day. #ThankYou

Before we close out the 2019-2020 school year, we want to share one more thank you to the heroes that make up the Arlington ISD maintenance and operations team. Tune in as students and parents join us in recognizing all of the hard work this super crew puts into keeping our schools clean and safe year-round.

For more details on how the Arlington ISD maintenance and operations team has supported the district throughout the COVID-19 closures, visit our blog post at https://www.aisd.net/district-news/arlington-isd-operations-and-maintenance-employees-serve-in-spite-of-covid-19/. #ArlingtonISD #SuperCrew

post_text:
Dallas Cowboys Executive Vice President and Chief Brand Officer Charlotte Jones joins Superintendent Dr. Marcelo Cavazos for a special graduation update. Arlington ISD parents and the Class of 2020: Get ready to graduate on June 5, 6 and 7 at AT&T Stadium in Arlington! We are grateful to the Gene and Jerry Jones Family Foundation and Charlotte Jones for providing these seven graduation ceremonies as a gift to Arlington ISD parents and students.
The graduation schedule is as follows:
-Lamar High School - Friday, June 5 - 3:30 p.m.
-Arlington High School - Saturday, June 6 - 10 a.m.
-Seguin High School - Saturday, June 6 - 3 p.m.
-James Martin High School - Saturday, June 6 - 8 p.m.
-Arlington Collegiate High School - Sunday, June 7 - 10 a.m.
-James Bowie High School - Sunday, June 7 - 3 p.m.
-Sam Houston High School - AISD - Sunday, June 7 - 8 p.m.
For complete details, check your latest parent email.

post_text: Arlington ISD Board of Trustees President Kecia Mays and Superintendent Dr. Marcelo Cavazos take a moment to express their gratitude to Arlington ISD teachers during National Teacher Appreciation Week. Our success as a district depends on key components such as commitment, effective teaching, a positive culture and an engaged community. Now more than ever we are experiencing teachers and parents joining together to educate students at an unprecedented level. Even with so much change in such a short amount of time, our teachers have not wavered and met every challenge head on. On behalf of everyone in Arlington ISD, thank you to our teachers. #ArlingtonISD #TeacherAppreciationWeek

post_text:
We couldn't have asked for a clearer sky today to celebrate and thank all the healthcare workers and first responders stationed on the front lines of COVID-19 in north Texas.

As a school district, everyday we look to our own nurses for guidance and education on the health of our students and staff. They are a part of our team, and they belong to our family.

In any setting and in order to offer the best care possible to patients, nurses work with a team of healthcare professionals, and that doesn‚Äôt change during a pandemic.

We are honored to have the opportunity to celebrate, along with our neighbors throughout DFW, the dedicated nurses and all healthcare workers it takes to treat those in need. To the first responders in our community, thank you from the bottom of our hearts for all you do to make sure our community is healthy and safe. #AmericaStrong #NationalNursesDay U.S. Navy Blue Angels

post_text:
In the midst of a pandemic that has school buildings closed all over the world, Teacher Appreciation Week takes on new meaning. Over the last several weeks, our teachers embraced a massive instructional change with courage and commitment as they learned to navigate the new At-Home Learning Hub. While the challenges have sometimes been overwhelming, our educators recognize it couldn‚Äôt be done without the new army of teachers - our Arlington ISD parents - and the incredible work they‚Äôre doing to keep the educational process moving ahead for their kids.
Thank you, teachers. Thank you, parents. You demonstrate the value of #TeachingTogether. #ArlingtonISD #TeacherAppreciationWeek

post_text:
The City of Arlington, TX - City Hall is offering free, drive-through testing for Tarrant County residents who meet testing eligibility criteria. Visit https://www.arlingtontx.gov/coronavirus and click on Drive -Through Testing for details.
-The tests are available by appointment.
-Testing occurs Monday through Friday.
-Tests are intended for individuals ages 18 and up who exhibit
symptoms of COVID-19.
-A valid photo ID with proof of residency at the time of
appointment is required.
-Pre-registration with the City of Arlington by phone or through
the city‚Äôs coronavirus website is required.
Call 817-248-6299 or visit www.arlingtontx.gov/coronavirus to make an appointment.

post_text:
Students: in a matter of days and even hours, so much has changed around us, causing an enormous amount of uncertainty. But we want you to know that our guidance and counseling team is available. If you need to discuss stress, anxiety or other counseling-related topics, call our hotline at 682-867-9416. Counselors are available to take calls Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.

*Please note: these calls offer support with counseling services that are normally provided throughout the school year by a school counselor.
https://www.aisd.net/coping-with-emergencies/

post_text:
Good news on the Student Meal Plan! The USDA waived the requirement that the child be present to receive their meal. We now have the option to allow parents and/or guardians to pick up meals for their children who are not present if appropriate documentation is shown. Anyone requesting a meal for a child who is not present with them must show one of the following forms of identification:
1. Student ID badge from the child‚Äôs school
2. Student report card from the 2019-20 school year
3. Birth certificate
4. An official letter/email from a district, charter or private school showing children in the household

*If you do not have any of the documents listed above for a child in need of a meal, you can still bring the child to the meal distribution site to receive food. Complete details at https://www.aisd.net/coronavirus/student-meal-plan-during-school-closure/.

post_text:
We have new details available for parents who still need to pick up a digital device for your Arlington ISD student. Device Day, the distribution of digital devices, will be Wednesday, April 1. Pickup locations will be at your child‚Äôs home campus. Please read through the FAQ‚Äôs on our website for complete details. Link: https://www.aisd.net/coronavirus/frequently-asked-questions/

Also, if you filled out the Student Device Request form last week and did not receive a device, you will need to fill out the form again at https://www.aisd.net/students/at-home-learning/. Due to demand, you will need to be registered to attend a distribution site on Wednesday. The deadline for completing the form is Tuesday, March 31 at noon.

And each phase of the four-phase launch of our At-Home Learning Hub will continue. More details can be found on our Coronavirus web page at aisd.net/coronavirus/.

post_text:
By the order of Texas Governor Greg Abbott, Arlington ISD schools will be closed through Friday, Apr. 3. Arlington ISD will follow this protocol in an effort to slow the spread of COVID-19.

While we do not have all of the answers for next steps, please be assured that our Student Meal Plan will continue throughout the closure. And each phase of the four-phase launch of our At-Home Learning Hub will continue. More details can be found on our Coronavirus web page at aisd.net/coronavirus/.
text:
By the order of Texas Governor Greg Abbott, Arlington ISD schools will be closed through Friday, Apr. 3. Arlington ISD will follow this protocol in an effort to slow the spread of COVID-19.

While we do not have all of the answers for next steps, please be assured that our Student Meal Plan will continue throughout the closure. And each phase of the four-phase launch of our At-Home Learning Hub will continue. More details can be found on our Coronavirus web page at aisd.net/coronavirus/.

post_text: Short Elementary was one of 23 Arlington ISD locations that began serving meals for students 18 and under today in an effort that will last each week during the school closure. After more discussions with local health officials, the Arlington ISD has decided to close schools for two weeks. As a precautionary measure to minimize the spread of COVID-19 all 78 campuses will remain closed until March 30. At this time, we plan for classes to resume on Monday, March 30. For more details and frequent updates on postponements and cancellations visit https://www.aisd.net/coronavirus/.

post_text: We‚Äôre coming to you LIVE from Butler Elementary School to launch the Fun At Bat program in partnership with the Texas Rangers Baseball Foundation and USA Baseball. The program encourages young people to participate in baseball- or softball-related activities, including formal leagues, special events and casual forms of play. Participating schools receive a Franklin Sports equipment kit, digital access to SHAPE America co-developed curriculums, and a pack of books for group reading during physical education. Teachers also have access to a free online course, hosted by former Major League Baseball player Michael Cuddyer, that covers the fundamentals of the Fun At Bat program. #ArlingtonISD USA Baseball

post_text: The shortest month of the year came to a close faster than a blink of an eye! From Arlington High School students celebrating Code Green and Arlington ISD Dan Dipert Career & Technical Center and Ag Center students flushing out the kinks in the plumbing system at Globe Life Field to Boles Junior High School making NBC 5, Dunn Elementary teacher Antonio Young and his students receiving media coverage on Access Hollywood and People.com and our Employee of the Month visits, we have a lot to be grateful for. Tune in to watch Haley Wehr and Kaelynne White explain in more detail. #ArlingtonISD

post_text: Short Elementary School, the Dallas Cowboys, Fuel Up to Play 60 and Dairy MAX know how important breakfast is so they all teamed up on Tuesday morning along with Cowboys offensive lineman Joe Looney for the Breakfast Games and an important message about eating healthy and exercising. Short Elementary moved to having breakfast in the classroom this school year so they could #FuelGreatness each day, and, since making that move, breakfast participation numbers have increased more than 53% over this time last year. Healthy breakfast = healthy minds! We are grateful for the support of such wonderful organizations! NFL #ArlingtonISD

post_text: Our mission is to empower and engage all students to be contributing, responsible citizens striving for their maximum potential through relevant, innovative and rigorous learning experiences. And lessons don‚Äôt get more innovative or empowering for students than what Duff Elementary School fourth-grade teachers Paige Kilpatrick and Tori Kennedy are doing with their math classes. Both teachers challenged students to work toward growth on a recent assessment by presenting them with the opportunity to do something out of the ordinary if they put forth full effort and showed improvement from one assessment to the next. The idea to let students tape their teachers to a tree actually came from Paige as she watched her junior high church group several weeks ago. They had so much fun taping their friends to a tree and she thought, ‚ÄúHey, this might just work as motivation for a few fourth-grade students I know.‚Äù #ArlingtonISD

post_text:
Johns Elementary School had many special visitors on Career Day last week, including the Dallas Zoo‚Äôs mammal curator of primates and carnivores Keith Zdrojewski. Keith‚Äôs visit to Mr. Julio Bosarreyes‚Äô class at Johns Elementary is special because students at the school are helping the Dallas Zoo recycle cell phones in an effort to save gorilla habitats in Africa.

We‚Äôre excited to have several of our schools, including Johns Elementary, join forces with the zoo to help save gorillas and their habitat in the wild by joining the Gorillas on the Line cell phone recycling campaign! Cell phones will be collected now through Thursday, Apr. 30, 2020. This is another example of how we inspire students to practice leadership, citizenship and responsibility. #GorillasOnTheLine #ArlingtonISD

Sam Houston High School‚Äôs Young Men of Color performed poetry by Langston Hughes, Maya Angelou and James Weldon Johnson in honor of Black History Month at this evening‚Äôs Board of Trustees meeting. The group comprised of four seniors and one junior weaved the poems together into one performance piece and delivered it in the classic ‚ÄúInterpreter‚Äôs Theater‚Äù oratory style.

If you would like to see the Young Men of Color and many other talented students perform live, join them THIS Friday, Feb. 21 at 5:30 p.m. at Sam Houston High School - AISD for the Black History Month - Bridging the Gap event. https://www.facebook.com/events/1303357576531177/ #BlackHistoryMonth #BridgingTheGap #ArlingtonISD

post_text:
Sam Houston High School - AISD head football coach Anthony Criss tells us how much his parents inspired him to pursue his career in high school sports. Listen in as Coach Criss talks about how influential his father, former head football coach at O.D. Wyatt High School in Fort Worth, was and how much his mother drove him to perform his best.
Arlington ISD is rich in diversity and proud of every one of our students and staff members. Help us celebrate Black History Month and learn more about leaders who have helped shape our community. We never stop learning, and this month is an excellent opportunity to open ourselves up to understanding even more about the significance of Black History Month. #BlackHistoryMonth #ArlingtonISD

post_text:
Today, counselors supported students and staff at Arlington High School as they began to cope with the tragic death of Samuel Reynolds, a 10th-grade student who was shot and killed late yesterday afternoon. In memory of Sam, ROTC students lowered the Colts flag in front of the school to half-staff this morning and students are now coordinating a candlelight vigil.

Last night, the Arlington Police Department notified district officials that an arrest had been made.

The District wants to thank the community for the overwhelming support and love they‚Äôve shown to the Arlington High School Colts family.

In memory of Sam, ROTC students lowered the Colts flag in front of the school to half-staff this morning and students are now coordinating a candlelight vigil.

post_text:
This statement from Dr. Marcelo Cavazos, Superintendent of Schools, Arlington ISD:

It is with great sadness that I share that one of our students at Arlington High School was fatally shot off campus after school today. The Arlington ISD asks that the community keep the family, classmates and teachers of this student in your thoughts.

The Arlington Police Department is leading the investigation and the District will support them with any needed information. Out of respect for the family and the minor status of the student, the Arlington ISD will not release the student‚Äôs name this evening.

School counselors are preparing to assist students beginning in the morning and continuing for as long as needed.

School counselors are preparing to assist students beginning in the morning and continuing for as long as needed.

We‚Äôre kickin‚Äô the weekend off at the Fort Worth Stock Show & Rodeo with our Agricultural Science Center students! It‚Äôs a BIG day for our kids at the stock show. Throughout the morning students will bring in their cattle, lambs & more to compete in a variety of livestock shows. Tune in to learn a little more about what these students are up to and how our programs at the Agricultural Science Center have grown over a few short years.

It‚Äôs our mission is to empower and engage all students to be contributing, responsible citizens striving for their maximum potential through relevant, innovative and rigorous learning experiences. And we‚Äôre proud to include agriculture opportunities to students looking to have careers in this arena.
#FWSSR #ArlingtonISD Fort Worth Stock Show & Rodeo

post_text:
Our mission is to empower and engage all students to be contributing, responsible citizens striving for their maximum potential through relevant, innovative and rigorous learning experiences ‚Äì and we‚Äôre honored to have such dedicated staff who support that mission. Meet one of January‚Äôs Employees of the Month, Lamar High School French teacher, Tiffany Manigault!

Tiffany is recognized for collaborating with teachers in other disciplines to create cross-curricular lessons for her students. She is currently creating a relationship with the Wimbish World Languages Academy so that Lamar French students can mentor and assist Wimbish students learning the language. Tiffany is highly creative and strives to make learning applicable and memorable for students. Thank you for all you do Tiffany!

post_text:
‚ÄúI‚Äôve always been the type of person who never stepped out of my comfort zone and played it safe. When I heard about this opportunity, I knew it was an opportunity to challenge myself as a person and as a student to get ready for college and the future.‚Äù said Ashley, a senior at the STEM Academy at Martin High School.

Students in the STEM Academy will have core classes geared toward STEM as well as STEM-specific classes. They‚Äôll also have opportunities to visit NASA, participate in the ROBO Boat Team, receive dual-credit and more. They can even participate in extracurricular activities and clubs.
Applications are being accepted for the STEM Academy now through Thursday, Jan. 30. Visit our website for more info and how to apply. https://www.aisd.net/district-news/stem-academy-at-martin-high-school-accepting-applications/ #ExploreArlingtonISD

post_text:
Arlington ISD is ready to make a BIG splash at the UIL District Swimming and Diving Championships this weekend! Dive in with us as we talk with coaches and athletes from Seguin, Martin and Bowie high schools during training this afternoon. üèä‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

The district championships are Saturday, Jan. 18at the Mansfield ISD Debbie Weems Natatorium. The District 8-5A meet begins at 9:15 a.m. and the District 4-6A meet begins at 2:15 p.m. Admission is $5 but free for children four and under and senior citizens.

Our goal in Arlington ISD is that 100% of our students graduate exceptionally prepared for college, career and citizenship. Participation in team sports such as swimming teaches students how to work together to achieve their goals. We wish the best of luck to all #ArlingtonISD high school swim teams competing in the UIL district meet this weekend! Arlington High School, James Bowie High School, Lamar High School, James Martin High School, Sam Houston High School - AISD and Seguin High School

The Board believes the FFC serves a vital function to Arlington ISD administration, the Board and local taxpayers. post_text:
Carter and Workman junior high school eighth-grade AVID students were invited to Sam Houston High School today. Upon arrival, they were greeted by high school AVID students in an assembly where Principal Juan Villarreal shared with the eighth graders all of the wonderful opportunities that are available to students at Sam Houston High School. Class of 2019 Sam Houston graduates were awarded $9,532,595 in scholarships!

Advancement Via Individual Determination or AVID is a college-readiness system focused on assisting first-generation college students, minorities underrepresented in colleges and much more. After the assembly, the eight graders went on a tour of the building, held interviews to participate in AVID at the high school level, received counseling about their fall schedules and more! If you would like more information about AVID at your school, call your campus directly. Sam Houston High School - AISD Carter Junior High #ArlingtonISD #SamFam

post_text:
Arlington ISD has canceled all after-school activities today, Friday, Jan. 10, due to severe weather predicted for the Metroplex. This includes all indoor and outdoor activities. According to the National Weather Service forecast as of 12:30 p.m., severe weather is expected to impact the Metroplex sometime after 4 p.m. and into the evening. Bus service will run as scheduled.

There are a number of free severe weather apps that you can download to your phone and customize to keep you updated on changing weather conditions including The Weather Channel, AccuWeather and the Red Cross Emergency App. You can also follow the National Weather Service on Twitter @NWSFortWorth.

Stay safe and we will see students back at school on Monday morning.

post_text:
As the holidays approach and the decade comes to a close, we want to take a moment to say thank you. Thank you to every parent, guardian, grandparent, aunt, uncle, employee and volunteer for the work you do day in and day out to support our vision that 100% of Arlington ISD students will graduate exceptionally prepared for college, career and citizenship.

You choose us to help guide your children. You choose us to share your professional expertise with. You choose us to donate your time to. For that we are truly grateful. Thank you. #ThankYou #ArlingtonISD #WarmestWishes

We‚Äôre LIVE in the gourmet kitchen at the Nutrition Services building! That‚Äôs right, we said gourmet kitchen. Meet baker, pastry chef and graduate of the Texas Culinary Academy in Austin Chef Karl Betts. Chef Betts is the supervisor for catering. He helps with recipe development which includes taste testing in schools. Chef Betts also contributes to training and operations.

Today, Chef Betts is going to show us how to make his delicious hot cocoa recipe. This is the perfect drink to make with your kiddos during the winter break. You don't want to miss it.Tune in! #ArlingtonISD #HolidayHowTo #HotChocolateRecipe
